Patient is a 45 year old male presenting with palpitations. Blood pressure today is 128/82, heart rate of 110 bpm, breathing at 18 breaths per minute, temperature is normal at 98.6F, oxygen saturation 98%.

History: Patient has hypertension and takes metoprolol 25mg twice daily. No known drug allergies.

Physical exam shows anxious appearing male. Heart is tachycardic but regular rhythm. Lungs are clear.

Labs drawn show troponin less than 0.01, BNP 125.

Impression: Sinus tachycardia, likely anxiety related. Hypertension controlled.

Will reassure patient, continue home medications, follow up with PCP in 1 week.
